bibl.title: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Hugh S. Cumming, December 14, 1922

div1.p: [Laura Carter] sends Cumming a list of Henry Carter's articles at the Army Medical Museum.

div1.head: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Hugh S. Cumming, December 14, 1922
div1.opener:
Biographic Data.
Dec. 14/22.
Dear Doctor Cumming:
div1.p:
I am sending you a partial list of Father's articles at the Army
Medical Museum. Had I time, I would make a new and complete list. I
think one would place the following articles in your category of original
work:

1. Note on the Interval between Infecting and Secondary Cases of
Yellow Fever from the Records of the Yellow Fever at Orwood and Taylor,
Miss., in 1898.

2. Period of Incubation of Yellow Fever in Man. (Planned with (1)
and (3) and written about the same time-- the triology forming a complete
work). Published in Medical Record, Feb. or March, 1901. Original manu-
scripts deposited in Army Medical Museum as permanent loan.

3. A Note on the Spread of Yellow Fever in Houses. Extrinsic In-
cubation. Medical Record, June 15, 1901.

4. Some Characteristics of Stegomyia Fasciata which Affect its
Conveyance of Yellow Fever. Medical Record, May 14, 1904.

5. Notes on the Sanitation of Yellow Fever and Malaria from Isth-
mism Experience. (Written for Pan-American Scientific Congress, held at
Santiago de Chile, Dec. 1908 to Jan. 1909). Medical Record, July 10/09.

6. Immunity to Yellow Fever. (Annals of Tropical Medicine and Para-
sitology. Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine, April, 1915) (Read be-
fore Pan-American Scientific Congress 1916.)

7. Spontaneous Disappearance of Yellow Fever by Failure of the Human
Host. Read before the Soceity of Tropical Medicine & Hygiene, (London),
June, 1917.

8. Mechanism of the Spontaneous Elimination of Yellow Fever from
Endemic Centers. Journal of Tropical Medicine & Parasitology. March 1920.
Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine.

Malaria:-- Four papers on the Effect of Impounded Waters on the Inci-
dence of Malaria. Published from 1915 to 1917. (Study not finished).

He has also written the articles on Yellow Fever for “The Practice
of Medicine in the Tropics”. Oxford Press, London, 1922.

(3) “A System of Pediatrics” (1920) (Edited by Isaac Abt.) W. B.
Saunders Pub. (Not yet published). 1924.
